required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of Ticagrelor on the Endothelial Healing Following Drug-eluting Stent Implantation in the Patients With Acute Coronary Syndrome

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators hypothesized that ticagrelor may enhance endothelial healing after DES implantation by increasing adenosine concentrations by the inhibition of adenosine uptake into erythrocytes, compared to clopidogrel. Thus, the investigators will evaluate the extent of endothelialization (stent strut coverage) and neointimal hyperplasia (neointimal thickness) 3 months after DES implantation by optical coherence tomography (OCT)

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.description: Percentage of stent coverage measured by OCT

clinical_study.condition: Patients Who Are Hospitalized and Expected to Undergo PCI for Acute Coronary Syndrome, Including Acute Myocardial Infarction and Unstable Angina.

intervention.description: Ticagrelor - 180 mg loading and 90 mg bid maintenance for 3 months
Clopidogrel - 600 mg loading and 75 mg qd maintenance for 3 months

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients â‰¥ 20 years old
- Patients who are hospitalized and expected to undergo PCI for acute coronary syndrome, including acute myocardial infarction and unstable angina.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age > 80 years
- Cardiogenic shock or unstable patients
- Increased risk of bleeding, anemia, thrombocytopenia
- A need for oral anticoagulation therapy
- Pregnant women or women with potential childbearing
- Life expectancy < 1 year

facility.name: Division of Cardiology, Yonsei Cardiovascular Hospital, Yonsei University College of Medicine

reference.citation: Patil SB, Jackman LE, Francis SE, Judge HM, Nylander S, Storey RF. Ticagrelor effectively and reversibly blocks murine platelet P2Y12-mediated thrombosis and demonstrates a requirement for sustained P2Y12 inhibition to prevent subsequent neointima. Arterioscler Thromb Vasc Biol. 2010 Dec;30(12):2385-91. doi: 10.1161/ATVBAHA.110.210732. Epub 2010 Nov 11.

Different patterns of neointimal coverage between acute coronary syndrome and stable angina after various types of drug-eluting stents implantation; 9-month follow-up optical coherence tomography study. Int J Cardiol. 2011 Feb 3;146(3):341-6. doi: 10.1016/j.ijcard.2009.07.012. Epub 2009 Aug 25.
